body:
dear happifeet01,

thanks for your answer. please read what i did:

>> if you manually edit the actual php.ini file (in plesk that is /var/www/vhosts/yourdomain/etc) and reload the administrator page that value is set as wished. you have to set "upload_max_filesize". but again you can't change it from administrator page.<<

i think that is exactly what you did on your server. but after editing php.ini the problem remains; one can't modify the values from admin panel. in my opinion very confusing. 

i think main problem is the plesk/apache/php/oc combination. some settings prevent that the .htaccess settings oc provides in the data directory don't have effect on such systems. 

but i can't figure out how to fix that.

annother question: how did you fix the fcgi problem on your system ? standard in plesk is 16mb. i found two possibilities to change that, and in combination with oc 5.06 and oc client 1.25 you really have to change both values. also very uggly problem. 

seems that pleak based systems are not ideal platform for oc hosting. pls see also next issue https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/3542 / endless upload - really overuggly problem. you've ever encountered similar problems ?

thanks

klaus

i’m closing this issue because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means that the issue is not reproducible or it has been fixed in a newer version.

please reopen if you still encounter this issue with the [latest stable version](http://owncloud.org/install/) (currently owncloud 5.0.10) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md). you an also contribute directly by providing a patch – see the [developer manual](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/). :)

thank you!
